contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Politician | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | | name = Yiannakis Matsis | caption = | birth_date = October 24, 1933 | birth_place = [[Palaichori]], [[Cyprus]] | residence = | death_date = | death_place = | office = 2nd President of [[DISY]] | term_start = 1993 | term_end = 1997 | predecessor = [[Glafkos Klerides]] | successor = [[Nicos Anastasiades]] | party = | religion = [[Church of Cyprus|Cypriot Orthodox]] | constituency = | majority = | spouse = | children = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Yiannakis Matsis''' (Born October 24, 1933) is a [[Cyprus|Cypriot]] politician and was [[Member of the European Parliament]] for the [[European People's Party]] from June 14, 2004 until June 2009. He didn't stand for re-election in the [[European elections, 2009]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Yiannakis MATSIS|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/members/archive/alphaOrder/view.do?language=EN&id=28516|publisher=[[Europa (web portal)]]|accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Members of the European Parliament 2004–2009}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Matsis, Yiannakis | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Cypriot politician | DATE OF BIRTH =October 24, 1933 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Palaichori]], [[Cyprus]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Matsis, Yiannakis}} [[Category:1933 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Nicosia District]] [[Category:Democratic Rally politicians]] [[Category:Cypriot refugees]] [[Category:Leaders of political parties in Cyprus]] [[Category:MEPs for Cyprus 2004–2009]] [[Category:Democratic Rally MEPs]] {{MEP-stub}} {{Cyprus-politician-stub}}
